subject: p15131736
Findings: The cardiac, mediastinal and hilar contours appear unchanged including stable cardiomegaly. There is no definite pleural effusion or pneumothorax. Each hilum is mildly prominent, as before. Prominence of each hilum is probably due to mild enlargement of central pulmonary arteries, not significantly changed. The lungs appear clear.
Impression: Similar enlargement of central pulmonary arteries, but no definite evidence for acute disease.
